name: Maps

aliases.name: Model
aliases.comment:
The map's model consists of the [properties necessary to display a static map](Maps-Map#Map),
a cache of the previous map (for simulated zooming/panning before the real tiles load in)
and the state of the map being dragged.
aliases.type: { map : Maps.Map.Map , cache : List Maps.Map.Map , drag : Maybe.Maybe Maps.Drag.Drag }

aliases.name: Options
aliases.comment:
The Options type allows you to configure the map display properties.

The tileServer property is a URL template of the form

    "http://somedomain.com/blabla/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"

Where {z} is the zoom level and {x}/{y} are the x/y tile coordinates.

The [bounds](Map-Bounds#Bounds) defines the area being viewed.

The width and height define the width and height of the map in pixels.

The tileSize defines the size of an individual tile in pixels (this is usually 256px).
aliases.type: { tileServer : String , bounds : Maps.Bounds.Bounds , width : Float , height : Float , tileSize : Float }

types.name: Msg
types.comment: The map has events for dragging, zooming and setting the bounds displayed by the map.

values.name: defaultOptions
values.comment:
A default set of options that displays Open Street Map tiles looking at Sydney.

    { tileServer = "http://a.tile.osm.org/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"
    , bounds = Bounds.Centered
      { zoom = 10
      , center = LatLng.sydney
      }
    , width = 600
    , height = 400
    , tileSize = 256
    }

values.name: map
values.comment: Creates the functions needed to make a map program from a set of [options](#Options).
values.type: Maps.Options -> { init : ( Maps.Model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd Maps.Msg ) , update : Maps.Msg -> Maps.Model -> ( Maps.Model, Platform.Cmd.Cmd Maps.Msg ) , subscriptions : Maps.Model -> Platform.Sub.Sub Maps.Msg , view : Maps.Model -> Html.Html Maps.Msg }

name: Maps.Map

aliases.name: Map
aliases.comment:
The Map type stores the properties neccessary for displaying a map.

The tileServer property is a URL template of the form

    "http://somedomain.com/blabla/{z}/{x}/{y}.png"

Where {z} is the zoom level and {x}/{y} are the x/y tile coordinates.

The zoom and center define the area being viewed.

The width and height define the width and height of the map in pixels.

The tileSize defines the size of an individual tile in pixels (this is usually 256px).
aliases.type: { tileServer : String , zoom : Maps.Screen.ZoomLevel , center : Maps.LatLng.LatLng , width : Float , height : Float , tileSize : Float }

types.name: Transformation
types.comment:
The transformations that account for the differences in placement and scale of tiles of a map.
Used for displaying the tile cache.

values.name: diff
values.comment:
Finds the transformations between two maps.
Useful for figuring out how to transform cached tiles into temporary substitutes of loading tiles.

values.name: drag
values.comment: Applies a drag (like a mouse drag) to the map

values.name: move
values.comment: Moves the map the number of pixels given by the offset.

values.name: tiles
values.comment: Returns the list of tiles necessary to fetch to display the map.

values.name: transformationStyle
values.comment: Returns a list of CSS properties/values for transforming map tiles.
values.type: Float -> Float -> List Maps.Map.Transformation -> List ( String, String )

values.name: viewBounds
values.comment: Moves the map to display the entire bounds given.

values.name: zoom
values.comment: Zooms the map in or out from the center of the map.

values.name: zoomTo
values.comment: Zooms the map in or out from the point given.

name: Maps.Bounds

types.name: Bounds
types.comment:
The Bounds type defines the bounds of a map.
It can be a rectangular bounding box defined by two points, or a point and a zoom level.

values.name: center
values.comment: Calculates the center point of a given Bounds.

values.name: zoom
values.comment:
The zoom function calculates the zoom level necessary to contain the given Bounds.

Note that the size of the tiles and map are needed to calculate the zoom level.

name: Maps.Screen

aliases.name: Offset
aliases.comment:
The Offset type defines an offset as it relates pixels making up a map.
For example the position of a mouse click, or a scroll action.

aliases.name: ZoomLevel
aliases.comment:
The level of zooming for the map.
This number has a [specific relation](http://wiki.openstreetmap.org/wiki/Slippy_map_tilenames#Zoom_levels) to the map tiles shown.

values.name: decodeOffset
values.comment: Decodes an HTML event which has an X and Y location into an Offset

values.name: decodeZoom
values.comment: Decodes an [HTML wheel event](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/WheelEvent) into a ZoomLevel

values.name: offsetFromTileOffset
values.comment:
This function is for converting a Tile.Offset to a Screen.Offset.

Note that It needs to know the size of the tiles to perform this conversion.

values.name: offsetToTileOffset
values.comment:
This function is for converting a Screen.Offset to a Tile.Offset.
It is used to figure out which tile, and subsequently which geographic point, a user clicked on for example.

Note that It needs to know the size of the tiles to perform this conversion.

name: Maps.LatLng

aliases.name: LatLng
aliases.comment: The LatLng type consists of a [latitude](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Latitude) and [longitude](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Longitude).

values.name: sydney
values.comment:
An example LatLng for Sydney.

    sydney = { lat = -33.865143, lng = 151.209900 }
